aws::graph::propositions: # Flight Incident Information
The incident occurred during taxi-from runway.
Windshear or thunderstorm was present during the incident.
Loss of control on ground was the defining event of the incident.
The aircraft experienced a nose over/nose down condition.
The incident resulted in collision with terrain/object (non-CFIT).
The flight instructor held a Commercial pilot certificate.
The flight instructor held a Flight instructor certificate.
The flight instructor was 24 years old.
The flight instructor had airplane ratings for Single-engine land.
The flight instructor had airplane ratings for Multi-engine land.
The flight instructor occupied the right seat.
The flight instructor had no other aircraft ratings.
The flight instructor used a 3-point restraint.
The flight instructor held an Instrument Rating for Airplane.
A second pilot was present during the incident.
The flight instructor held instructor ratings for Airplane multi-engine.
The flight instructor held instructor ratings for Airplane single-engine.
The flight instructor held instructor ratings for Instrument airplane.
No toxicology was performed on the flight instructor.
The flight instructor held a Class 1 Medical Certification without waivers/limitations.
The flight instructor's last FAA Medical Exam was on July 18, 2013.
The flight instructor was an occupational pilot.
The flight instructor's last Flight Review or Equivalent was on June 25, 2013.
The flight instructor had 1614 total flight hours in all aircraft.
The flight instructor had 1024 total flight hours in this make and model.
The flight instructor had 1513 Pilot In Command hours in all aircraft.
The flight instructor had 88 flight hours in the last 90 days in all aircraft.
The flight instructor had 20 flight hours in the last 30 days in all aircraft.
The flight instructor had 3 flight hours in the last 24 hours in all aircraft.
The student pilot held no pilot certificate.
The student pilot was 47 years old.
The student pilot had no airplane ratings.
The student pilot occupied the left seat.
The student pilot had no other aircraft ratings.
The student pilot used a 3-point restraint.
The student pilot had no instrument ratings.
The student pilot had no instructor ratings.
No toxicology was performed on the student pilot.
The student pilot had no medical certification.
The student pilot was not an occupational pilot.
The student pilot had 9 total flight hours in all aircraft.
The student pilot had 9 total flight hours in this make and model.

text:
# Factual Information

## History of Flight

| Taxi-from runway | Windshear or thunderstorm |
| Taxi-from runway | Loss of control on ground (Defining event) |
| Taxi-from runway | Nose over/nose down |
| Taxi-from runway | Collision with terr/obj (non-CFIT) |

## Flight instructor Information

| Certificate: | Commercial; Flight instructor |
| Age: | 24 |
| Airplane Rating(s): | Single-engine land; Multi-engine land |
| Seat Occupied: | Right |
| Other Aircraft Rating(s): | None |
| Restraint Used: | 3-point |
| Instrument Rating(s): | Airplane |
| Second Pilot Present: | Yes |
| Instructor Rating(s): | Airplane multi-engine; Airplane single-engine; Instrument airplane |
| Toxicology Performed: | No |
| Medical Certification: | Class 1 Without waivers/limitations |
| Last FAA Medical Exam: | July 18, 2013 |
| Occupational Pilot: | Yes |
| Last Flight Review or Equivalent: | June 25, 2013 |
| Flight Time: | 1614 hours (Total, all aircraft), 1024 hours (Total, this make and model), 1513 hours (Pilot In Command, all aircraft), 88 hours (Last 90 days, all aircraft), 20 hours (Last 30 days, all aircraft), 3 hours (Last 24 hours, all aircraft) |

## Student pilot Information

| Certificate: | None |
| Age: | 47 |
| Airplane Rating(s): | None |
| Seat Occupied: | Left |
| Other Aircraft Rating(s): | None |
| Restraint Used: | 3-point |
| Instrument Rating(s): | None |
| Second Pilot Present: | Yes |
| Instructor Rating(s): | None |
| Toxicology Performed: | No |
| Medical Certification: | None |
| Occupational Pilot: | No |
| Flight Time: | 9 hours (Total, all aircraft), 9 hours (Total, this make and model) |
